title: Bonjour Advertising Services (com.apple.mDNSResponder)
description: Control Bonjour Advertising Services settings. Bonjour is an auto-discovery mechanism for TCP/IP devices which enumerate devices and services within a local subnet. DNS on macOS is integrated with Bonjour and should not be turned off, but the Bonjour advertising service can be disabled.

NoMulticastAdvertisements.title: Disable Bonjour Advertising Services (Multicast Advertisements)
NoMulticastAdvertisements.description: Set to true to disable Bonjour Advertising Services. Bonjour can simplify device discovery from an internal rogue or compromised host. An attacker could use Bonjour's multicast DNS feature to discover a vulnerable or poorly-configured service or additional information to aid a targeted attack. Implementing this control disables the continuous broadcasting of 'I'm here!' messages.
